definitions.definition: A place where items may be accumulated or routinely kept.
definitions.example: This building used to be a store for old tires.

definitions.definition: (mainly North American) A place where items may be purchased; a shop.
definitions.example: I need to get some milk from the grocery store.
The main store of 1000 36-bit words seemed large at the time.

definitions.definition: A great quantity or number; abundance.
To keep (something) while not in use, generally in a place meant for that purpose.
definitions.example: I'll store these books in the attic.

definitions.definition: To write (something) into memory or registers.
definitions.example: This operation stores the result on the stack.
